properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High northwest winds gusting near 90 km/h are expected this afternoon. Winds are expected to diminish early this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-09T01:59:36-00:00

Area: Chevery

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for high water levels. Strong southwesterly winds along with high waves and pounding surf behind Post Tropical Storm Dorian may result in higher than normal water levels during high tide early this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-09T02:26:50-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Tropical Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Tropical storm force winds of 70 gusting to 100 km/h and possibly higher over exposed areas from Hurricane Dorian can be expected over the above regions. ### This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. These winds could break large tree branches resulting in downed utility lines. Some damage to signage and roof shingles may also occur. A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions (sustained winds near 65 km/h or more) are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-09T02:59:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T20:04:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2867341806.2019

properties.Title: Hurricane Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hurricane force winds of 90 gusting to 130 km/h at exposed locations except 120 gusting to 150 km/h at the coast with surge of 0.7 to 1.0 m and waves from 4 to 7 m from Hurricane Dorian are expected. Hurricane conditions are expected to develop this morning as Dorian quickly approaches the region. The current track has Dorian moving over the eastern Gulf of St. Lawrence this morning and then over the northern Peninsula this afternoon. Winds gusting up to 150 km/h are expected, especially along coastal areas. ### These winds will topple many trees leading to downed utility lines and extended service outages. Moderate to significant damage to roofing materials, exterior cladding and light structures is likely. This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. A hurricane warning means that hurricane conditions are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Hurricane conditions include (A) sustained winds near 120 km/h or more, and/or (B) significantly elevated water levels and dangerous surf along the coast. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-09T01:59:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T13:33:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2978114603.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Higher than normal water levels with large waves are expected near the coast. Warning of potential breaking sea conditions and coastal flooding issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec region on 2019-09-08. Post-tropical storm Dorian is generating strong winds across the regions specified below. The passage of the storm could cause coastal flooding near the following localities, on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern daylight time). Chevery: 2019-09-08 until 10:00 PM. Blanc-Sablon: 2019-09-08 until 10:00 PM. ### Coastal flooding is possible along the shoreline. Coastal erosion is possible in vulnerable areas. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-09T03:59:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T19:18:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2625093223.2019
Area: Chevery, Blanc-Sablon

properties.Title: Tropical Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Tropical storm force winds of 70 gusting to 100 km/h and possibly higher over exposed areas from Hurricane Dorian can be expected over the above regions. Tropical storm conditions are expected as Dorian quickly approaches and moves through the region. The current track has Dorian moving ear the northern Peninsula this afternoon. Strong southwesterly winds gusting up to 110 km/h are expected, especially along coastal areas. A special weather statement is in effect for the possibility of storm surge as Dorian nears the Great Northern Peninsula ### This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Shoreline erosion and wave overwash is expected where winds blow onshore. These winds could break large tree branches resulting in downed utility lines. Some damage to signage and roof shingles may also occur. A tropical storm warning means that tropical storm conditions (sustained winds near 65 km/h or more) are expected over parts of the region within 24 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Dangerous wind gusts causing widespread damage are expected or occurring. Strong southwesterly winds, with gusts reaching 150 km/h along parts of the coast, will ease below warning criteria late this afternoon or evening. ### Buildings under construction risk extreme damage. High winds may cause numerous downed trees and damage may occur from blowing debris. Drivers may lose control of their vehicles; tall vehicles are at high risk of being overturned. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Tropical Cyclone Information Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: For Post-tropical Storm Dorian. The next full information statement will be issued by 9:30 p.m. NDT. Dorian moving into the Strait of Belle Isle, and will move away from North America towards Europe. 1. Summary of basic information at 6:30 p.m. ADT. Location: 51.1 North 57.4 West. About 108 kilometres north of Daniel's Harbour. Maximum sustained winds: 93 kilometres per hour. Present movement: east-northeast at 43 kilometres per hour. Minimum central pressure: 968 millibars. 2. Summary of latest information. After doing significant to severe damage to the Maritimes, Dorian is completing the job as it approaches Newfoundland. Tropical Storm Warnings remain in effect for most the the West Coast of Newfoundland, as well as the Northern Peninsula and the Northeast Coast from White Bay to the Bay of Exploits. Over the last couple of hours gusts to 110 km/h have been observed, as well as sustained winds of up to 90 km/h. Power outages have been reported from Port aux Basque north to the Straight of Belle Isle, and for parts of the Northeast Coast. Storm surge is still a concern, as are high waves. A special weather statement for higher than normal water levels and rough and pounding surf is in effect for Western Newfoundland and the Northern Peninsula. Forecaster: Mercer ### Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-09-09T10:59:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-08T22:26:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1298686857.2019

properties.Summary:
Description: Tropical storm force winds of 70 gusting to 100 km/h and possibly higher over exposed areas from Hurricane Dorian can be expected over the above regions. Tropical storm conditions are expected as Dorian quickly moves through the region. Dorien is moving near or into the Strait of Bell Isle. Strong southwesterly winds gusting up to 110 km/h are expected, especially along coastal areas east and south of the low centre.. A special weather statement is in effect for the possibility of flooding from storm surge and waves. ### This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. Some damage to signage and roof shingles may also occur. properties.Title: Tropical Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Tropical storm force winds of 60 gusting to 90 km/h over exposed areas from Post-tropical Storm Dorian can be expected over the above regions. High water levels with potential for significant flooding will diminish by late this afternoon ### This could result in some damage to docks and breakwaters. By nature, a tropical storm also implies the threat of local flooding from heavy rainfall - consult your local area forecast for possible rainfall warnings. Please continue to monitor alerts issued by the Canadian Hurricane Centre and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. Reports of storm conditions and impacts can be emailed directly to NSstorm@canada.ca or by tweeting reports by province using #NSStorm, #NBStorm, #PEStorm, #NLwx, #QCStorm or #ONStorm.
